roleset.name: make sure, guarantee
roleset.note: INSURE-V NOTES: Member of Vncls ensure-99. Can also be 'ensure'; technically the two are different but modernusage conflates the two. *sigh* barbarians at the gates, and all that. (from insure.01-v)

example.name: arg1 usually a propositon
example.text: ``Our intent is *trace*-1 to spread them out ''*trace*-1 to insure they are well integrated into the community, he said.
example.arg: they are well integrated into the community

roleset.name: act like an insurance agency
roleset.note: INSURE-V NOTES: Member of Vncls defend-85. VN updated by Julia, 10/2010. (from insure.02-v)

example.name: transitive
example.text: Right now, the largest loan [0]-1 the FHA can insure *trace*-1 in high-cost housing markets is $101,250.

example.name: with amount
example.text: He assumed that [principal and interest]-1 were ``fully insured *trace*-1 up to $100,000,'' he adds.

example.name: with beneficiary
example.text: The agency, which is funded through insurance premiums from employers, insures pension benefits for some 30 million private-sector workers who take part in single-employer pension plans.
example.arg: The agency, which is funded through insurance premiums from employers,
for some 30 million private-sector workers who take part in single-employer pension plans

example.name: with danger
example.text: Then, if the stocks fell sharply, he planned to begin buying them aggressively, on the theory that the companies that-1 *trace*-1 insure against property damage and accidents will have to raise rates eventually to compensate for the claims they will pay to earthquake victims and victims of last month's Hurricane Hugo.
